newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Inovax buys drug maker Ponco for A$95 mln.
newsitem.headline: Inovax buys drug maker Ponco for A$95 mln.

text.p: Inovax Ltd said on Monday that it had acquired the Indonesian holding company Circa International Ltd and its drug manufacturing unit PT Ponco Indonesia for A$94.6 million and the assumption of liabilities.
Inovax said the liabilities amounted to about A$20 million.

The company said that in a related move it had received a letter of intent from Bakrie Securities, which was acting on behalf of the privately-owned Bakrie Group and other independent investors, to invest a total of about A$60.8 million of new equity in Inovax. It did not specify a time frame.
It said the investment by Bakrie would be priced at about the Inovax share price on June 28, when the commitment was received. Bakrie controls Bakrie and Brothers.
Inovax had a market capitalisation of A$36.78 million based on its trading price of A$1.10 on Monday afternoon, which was up 10 cents from Friday's close.
Ponco, which has a manufacturing facility in West Java, was expected to have sales of about A$38 million this year, Inovax said.

It said Ponco was ranked among the top ten domestic Indonesian ethical drug manufacturers and was expanding its manufacturing capability with a new cephalosporin (anti-infective) facility and a new sterile facility for injectable and ophthalmic products.
These were scheduled for completion in 1998, and should add significantly to Ponco's revenues, Inovax said.
